multiple-choice.question: What is the reactivity series of metals, and how is it used in the experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: The reactivity series is a list of metals in order of their reactivity, and it is used to predict which metal will win in a competition reaction.

options.label: B
options.text: The reactivity series is a list of metals in order of their density, and it is used to predict which metal will sink or float in a solution.

options.label: C
options.text: The reactivity series is a list of metals in order of their melting points, and it is used to predict which metal will melt first in a reaction.

options.label: D
options.text: The reactivity series is a list of metals in order of their boiling points, and it is used to predict which metal will boil first in a reaction.

options.label: D
options.text: To change the temperature of the solution.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the competition reaction between silver and copper?

options.label: A
options.text: Copper wins the reaction and precipitates solid silver crystals.

options.label: B
options.text: Silver wins the reaction and precipitates solid copper crystals.

options.label: C
options.text: The reaction is a tie, and both metals precipitate solid crystals.

options.label: D
options.text: The reaction does not occur, and no crystals are formed.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Tyndall Cone effect, and how is it observed in the experiment?

options.label: A
options.text: The Tyndall Cone effect is the scattering of light by particles in a solution, and it is observed as a cone of light when a torch is shone through the solution.

options.label: B
options.text: The Tyndall Cone effect is the reflection of light by particles in a solution, and it is observed as a cone of light when a torch is shone through the solution.

options.label: C
options.text: The Tyndall Cone effect is the absorption of light by particles in a solution, and it is observed as a dark cone when a torch is shone through the solution.

options.label: D
options.text: The Tyndall Cone effect is the transmission of light by particles in a solution, and it is observed as a bright cone when a torch is shone through the solution.

title: What we can learn from galaxies far, far away - Henry Lin

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: A type of matter that interacts with normal matter through gravity

options.label: C
options.text: A type of matter that makes up most of the universe's atoms

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: A type of energy that causes the universe to expand at an ever-increasing rate

options.label: C
options.text: A type of hot gas found in galaxy clusters

options.label: D
options.text: A type of particle accelerator

options.label: C
options.text: By creating a huge particle accelerator

options.label: D
options.text: By studying the expansion of the universe

title: Why do we cry? The three types of tears - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about Iris's emotional state?

options.label: A
options.text: She is always happy and cheerful.

options.label: B
options.text: She is very sensitive and cries frequently.

options.label: C
options.text: She is never sad or upset.

options.label: D
options.text: She has no emotional response to situations.

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the lacrimal glands in Iris's eyes?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce new tears.

options.label: B
options.text: To drain old tears away.

options.label: C
options.text: To protect her skin from damage.

options.label: D
options.text: To repel invasive bacteria.

multiple-choice.question: What are the three layers of the basal tears that Iris constantly produces?

options.label: A
options.text: Mucus, aqueous, and lipid.

options.label: B
options.text: Aqueous, lipid, and cornea.

options.label: C
options.text: Mucus, cornea, and lipid.

options.label: D
options.text: Aqueous, mucus, and cornea.

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the lipid layer in Iris's basal tears?

options.label: A
options.text: To keep the surface smooth for Iris to see through.

options.label: B
options.text: To repel invasive bacteria.

options.label: C
options.text: To protect her skin from damage.

options.label: D
options.text: To prevent the other layers from evaporating.

options.text: To protect her skin from damage.
